author: The Athletic Staff
title: Wrexham‚Äôs Paul Mullin, Elliot Lee sign contract extensions until 2027
text:
Wrexham striker Paul Mullin and midfielder Elliot Lee have signed contract extensions with the club until 2027.
The League Two side announced the news on New Year‚Äôs Day, with a midnight announcement shared by owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney.
Mullin has scored 89 goals in 116 appearances since joining Wrexham in 2021, while Lee is the club‚Äôs top scorer this season with 13 goals in 29 games in all competitions.
Happy New Year,
[@Wrexham_AFC]üè¥üè¥
‚Äî Ryan Reynolds (@VancityReynolds)
[January 1, 2024]
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre delighted we‚Äôve agreed deals with Paul and Elliot. They are two really key players for the club moving forward,‚Äù manager Phil Parkinson told the club website.
Advertisement
‚ÄúThere‚Äôs always a lot of talk going into a transfer window, but the most important thing is to keep hold of your best players ‚Äî they are two very important signings for us.‚Äù
Mullin said: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm unbelievably happy and grateful to extend my stay at Wrexham. Since signing for the club, I‚Äôve loved every single second. It‚Äôs not just become my club, but my whole family also.‚Äù
Lee said: ‚ÄúIt means a lot. When I signed 18 months ago, there were high expectations but not I even saw just how well it was going to go. I‚Äôm delighted to be extending my stay with Wrexham.‚Äù
Wrexham are third in the fourth tier following Friday‚Äôs 3-1 loss at Walsall as they attempt to secure back-to-back promotions after winning the National League. They return to action at home to Barrow on January 1.
